michelle.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendars.

steven.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendars.

jerry.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's calendars.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that results in a one-hour meeting scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

public_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00.
The meeting must be scheduled on Monday within work hours.
Time granularity is 30 minutes for availability calculation.

availability.system_prompt: You are Michelle's calendar assistant. Based on the public information and your private calendar entries, compute your available one-hour time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Use the provided time granularity and return a list of possible start times in HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Agent: michelle. Public info: Work hours 09:00-17:00 on Monday, meeting duration 60 minutes, time granularity 30 minutes. Private info: Monday busy 11:00-12:00. Provide all one-hour start times that fit Michelle's calendar on Monday. Output a simple JSON-friendly list of start times such as ["09:00","09:30",...]. Do not produce PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are Steven's calendar assistant. Based on the public information and your private calendar entries, compute your available one-hour time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Use the provided time granularity and return a list of possible start times in HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Agent: steven. Public info: Work hours 09:00-17:00 on Monday, meeting duration 60 minutes, time granularity 30 minutes. Private info: Monday busy 09:00-09:30, 11:30-12:00, 13:30-14:00, 15:30-16:00. Provide all one-hour start times that fit Steven's calendar on Monday. Output a simple JSON-friendly list of start times. Do not produce PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are Jerry's calendar assistant. Based on the public information and your private calendar entries, compute your available one-hour time slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Use the provided time granularity and return a list of possible start times in HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Agent: jerry. Public info: Work hours 09:00-17:00 on Monday, meeting duration 60 minutes, time granularity 30 minutes. Private info: Monday busy 09:00-09:30, 10:00-11:00, 11:30-12:30, 13:00-14:30, 15:30-16:00, 16:30-17:00. Provide all one-hour start times that fit Jerry's calendar on Monday. Output a simple JSON-friendly list of start times. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the availability lists from the three agents and determine a one-hour slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for everyone. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem modeled for the FastDownwards solver that represents the scheduling problem and encodes the chosen meeting start time as the intended plan solution. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for different agents distinct and include typing and predicates suitable for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Inputs: avail_michelle, avail_steven, avail_jerry. Compute the intersection of available one-hour start times and pick a valid start time that fits all agents. Produce a PDDL domain and problem pair for FastDownwards that models a simple scheduling task where the plan places the meeting at the chosen start time. Enclose domain between <domain></domain> and problem between <problem></problem>. If no common slot exists, explicitly state that and model a problem that reflects the infeasibility. Do not include extraneous scheduler operational text.
